page.title: 03Laurel Farm, Felixstowe
page.content: The area covered by Laurel Farm is{ {1400 acres.}It is completely mixed farming. The farmer grows cereal crops and has{Simmental}cows, but the farm is mainly known for their red and white{Friesians.}The Simmental cows are for beef and have won many prizes. The red and white Friesians are for milking and are out in the fields most of the time and are brought in for milking. Laurel Farm owns Suffolk sheep and horses. One of their Suffolk Punches achieved the{Champion of the {Suffolk Show}in{1985.}One of their mares won a second place. One of the farmhouses is one of the oldest houses in Felixstowe. The owner of the farm lives opposite this house. The farmland covers a wide expanse of land including marshes.
